org.as2lib.ant
Class Swfsli

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.tools.ant.ProjectComponent
      org.apache.tools.ant.Task
          org.as2lib.ant.Swfsli

public class Swfsli
extends org.apache.tools.ant.Task

Swfsli allows to add/modify/remove the "ScriptLimits" tag of a SWF file.

The "ScriptLimits" tag is recognized by Flash Player 7 and above. The Tag contains 2 values:

  • Maximum Recursion Depth (0..65535)
  • Script Timeout Seconds (0..65535)

Example: 

<swfsli swf="${src.dir}/app.swf" recursion="10000" timeout="500"/>

This task can take the following arguments:

  • swf (SWF file to adapt the "ScriptLimits" tag of)
  • recursion (new recursion depth)
  • timeout (new script timeout)
  • delete (remove "ScriptLimits" tag?)
  • backup (backup original file?)
  • verbose (enable verbose mode?)

Since:
29.06.2006
Author:
Igor Sadovskiy, Simon Wacker
See Also:
SWF ScriptLimits Injector (SWFSLI), Apache Ant

Constructor Detail

Swfsli

public Swfsli()
Method Detail

setSwfsli

public void setSwfsli(java.lang.String swfsli)
Sets the path to or name of the swfsli executable.

The path can either be an absolute path: E:/Programming/Flash/swfsli/swfsli.exe

or a relative path: exe/swfsli/swfsli.exe

You may also just use the name of the executable (without the file extension) if the directory it resides in is included in the 'PATH' environment variable: swfsli

If you do not set a swfsli executable SWFSLI will be used. This requires that you include the directory in which the swfsli executable resides in the 'PATH' environment variable.

Parameters:
swfsli - the path to or name of the swfsli executable

getSwfsli

public java.lang.String getSwfsli()
Returns the path to or name of the swfsli executable.

If the swfsli executable has not been set, the default executable name SWFSLI will be returned.

Returns:
the path to or name of the swfsli executable

setBackup

public void setBackup(boolean backup)
Specifies whether the original SWF file shall be backed-up. The file will be copied to a file with the same name but with the ".bak" extension appended. For example, my.swf will be backed-up as my.swf.bak.

isBackup

public boolean isBackup()
Returns whether the original SWF file will be backed-up.

setVerbose

Specifies whether verbode mode shall be enabled or disabled. If enabled SWFSLI will display more information about warnings and errors.
